intro: Tetraria raynaliana, commonly known as the golden star moss, is a rare and specialized liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped thalli. The plant exhibits a unique structure with a central axis surrounded by radiating lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a valuable species for ecological and botanical study.
